timeline.message: Increment package version after release of com.azure azure-storage-common
Update versions for all storage libraries except common

replies.bodyText: Not too sure - that was there before I manually updated
replies.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText: @vcolin7 and @g2vinay This seems like a valid change, but not sure why it should be happening in this PR. Could you confirm why we are seeing this change and if should be checked in?
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText:
I notice, @YijunXieMS  PR added the x-version tags to smoke tests.
But, it didn't use dep version for KV, while it used dep x-version tag, so that looks incorrect to me in that PR.
4666053#diff-f72ca982328bdb85aef7520207fbd08c38b15d828847b368b7d052172601c88f
I think it should be fine to keep this change in your PR.
Since previously, smoke tests were using the stable release.
But, going forward, I'd debate using current tags on these, since smoke tests ideally should spot issues in the source code, I think.
replies.author: g2vinay
